<a id="BoxMesh"></a>

# BoxMesh

**Inherits:** [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md) **\<** [Mesh](Mesh.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Generate an axis-aligned box [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Generate an axis-aligned box [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md).

The box's UV layout is arranged in a 3Ã—2 layout that allows texturing each face individually. To apply the same texture on all faces, change the material's UV property to ``Vector3(3, 2, 1)``. This is equivalent to adding ``UV *= vec2(3.0, 2.0)`` in a vertex shader.

\ **Note:** When using a large textured **BoxMesh** (e.g. as a floor), you may stumble upon UV jittering issues depending on the camera angle. To solve this, increase [subdivide_depth](BoxMesh.md#BoxMesh_property_subdivide_depth), [subdivide_height](BoxMesh.md#BoxMesh_property_subdivide_height) and [subdivide_width](BoxMesh.md#BoxMesh_property_subdivide_width) until you no longer notice UV jittering.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->
